instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00609: What is 820-00609? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00597: What is 820-00597? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00609</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Doesn't power on after shutdown
threads.message:
Got this iMac 27 that owner had attempted some work on and now won't power on. What i noticed was after it's power on the first time and then shutdown, it won't power on until the power plug is removed for a few seconds. Looking at the board LED's, when i first power it up, all the LED's on (except when display is removed, three LED comes on). Once i shut it down, all but the first led's goes off, except the first LED is very dim. At the point i'm unable to power it back up until i unplug the power cord and reconnect, then the firs LED brightens up again and i can power it.

Found a couple broken components, the ethernet port pulse transformer (on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00597</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, this is either T4020 or 4025). Since this is for the ethernet port, and since couldn't find a replacement, i went ahead and cleaned up the traces and lift it black along with removing the inductor connected to it. 
Another broken component, which i replaced was one of the usb esd protection diode. 

Any suggestions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00609</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Doesn't power on after shutdown
threads.message:
Try first changing <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL> MOSFET.
Next step should be to change 3V3/5V controller chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00609</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Doesn't power on after shutdown
threads.message: Customer changed mind on repair since I wasn't able to locate a pulse transformer for the ethernet port locally. They weren't willing to wait on the parts to be ordered. Anyway, thanks for the assist
